Speaker: dream children
Dialogue: One... two... Freddy's coming for you.

Speaker: dream children
Dialogue: Three... four... better lock your door.

Speaker: dream children
Dialogue: Five... six...

Speaker: dream children
Dialogue: ...grab your crucifix.. ix.. ix..

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Lizzy?

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Lizzy. What are you doing here?

Speaker: lizzy
Dialogue: Playing with my friend.

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Your friend?

Speaker: lizzy
Dialogue: He lives under the bed.

Speaker: lizzy
Dialogue: You scared him...

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: I scared him?

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Lizzy?

Speaker: freddy
Dialogue: Where ya been all my death, baby?

Speaker: freddy
Dialogue: I've been waitin' at the altar for a long, long time!

Speaker: satanic priest
Dialogue: Are the bridesmaids in attendance?

Speaker: satanic priest
Dialogue: And the groomsmen...?

Speaker: satanic priest
Dialogue: If anyone here believes that these two should not be joined in unholy matrimony, let him speak now or forever rot in hell...

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Meagan!

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Jesse!

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Freddy...

Speaker: freddy doll
Dialogue: Well it ain't Raggedy Ann, bitch!

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Wake up, sleepy head. Time to wake up.

Speaker: lizzy
Dialogue: I had a bad dream.

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Me, too.

Speaker: lizzy
Dialogue: I was scared.

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Don't worry... they can't hurt you.

Speaker: lizzy
Dialogue: Promise?

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Promise.

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: I'll never let anyone hurt you.

Speaker: news reporter
Dialogue: As the sun rises on yet another morning, still no end in sight for the standoff between police and the mysterious group known only as the "Freddy" cult who seized the abandoned house behind me just thirteen days ago.  These cultists -- mostly run- away teenagers -- have managed to keep police at bay for almost two weeks while inside they take mind- altering narcotics in order to communicate with their god -- Freddy.

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Morning.

Speaker: meagan's dad
Dialogue: Morning, Meagan.

Speaker: meagan's mom
Dialogue: Lizzy! Get down here! Breakfast is almost ready!

Speaker: news reporter
Dialogue: Alleged child murderer Fred Krueger was released on a legal technicality but later burned to death at the hands of a vigilante mob of grieving parents.  Some years later, a rash of bizarre and unexplainable teen- age deaths began leaving many in the area to wonder... is Freddy really dead?

Speaker: meagan's mom
Dialogue: Hurry up and eat. You don't want to be late for special school.

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Mom! Don't call it that!

Speaker: lizzy
Dialogue: I hate that school. The other kids are mean... and they're all re- tard-ed!

Speaker: meagan's mom
Dialogue: We don't use that word. They're "special" children just like you're "special".

Speaker: news reporter
Dialogue: The cult members have declined to an on-camera interview but did send out a note with a message. The note -- which, by the way, appears to have been written in blood -- reads...  To the parents of Springwood -- Freddy lives! Soon he will come and take one of your children as his virgin bride. Then Freddy will -BEEP- and his -BEEP- upon her -BEEP- and -BEEP- and behold, a soulless child shall be born. The vessel for Freddy to rise and rule the darkness forever and ever.

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: That's Jesse. Let's go, Lizzy.

Speaker: meagan's dad
Dialogue: Oh, look at the time! I've got to be going... anyone need me to bring anything home tonight?

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: I need an alarm clock.

Speaker: meagan's dad
Dialogue: What's wrong with your old one?

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Broke.

Speaker: meagan's mom
Dialogue: We're almost out of vodka.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Good morning! Hey, what's the matter?

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: My mom...

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: And...?

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: I had another dream last night...

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Was I naked?

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: No. You were Jason.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Jason? Oh, yeech...  Was I any good?

Speaker: meagan's dad
Dialogue: Do you have to watch that crap all the time? Months and months of the O.J. Simpson trial, and now this...

Speaker: news reporter
Dialogue: I'm standing here with State Trooper Captain Renton Murdoch, the man the Governor has called in to deal with the cultists because of his past experience with occult-style murderers. In fact, Trooper Murdoch is the only law enforcement officer ever to survive a one-on-one encounter with notorious Camp Crystal Lake killer -- Jason Voorhees.  You received some pretty nasty injuries in your battle with Jason, didn't you, Captain?

Speaker: murdoch
Dialogue: Nothing serious... just a few stitches.

Speaker: news reporter
Dialogue: What about these so called "Freddy" cultists? They seem like pretty tough customers. Think you'll have any trouble getting them out of there?

Speaker: murdoch
Dialogue: No. Now that the Governor has given me complete authority to deal with these punks I should be putting an end to their situation pretty quick. Unless of course their attorney is able to get them to come out peace- fully... but I don't hold out much hope for that.

Speaker: news reporter
Dialogue: Captain Renton Murdoch, ladies and gentlemen. A tough cop... for tough criminals.

Speaker: murdoch
Dialogue: Damn media... oughtta be a law.  Is that shyster still in there trying to talk them out?

Speaker: murdoch
Dialogue: Damn lawyers... what a bunch of assholes. Shakespeare was right -- kill all the lawyers. Then we could kill all the punks with no hassles and the world would be a safer place.

Speaker: murdoch
Dialogue: Ahhhhh... what did Shakespeare know? Long-haired, English freak. He was probably a punk.

Speaker: sleazy lawyer
Dialogue: So, as I explained to you before, the revenues between the TV movie deal and the book sale should be adequate to fund your joint-defense. And I think with my mass media hypnosis argument I could get each of you a reduced sentence on appeal -- say... twenty years each. Out in fifteen with good behavior? Hmmmmm?

Speaker: murdoch
Dialogue: Freeze!

Speaker: murdoch
Dialogue: Looks like we'll have to hunt the rest of them down. Let's go before they get too far.

Speaker: murdoch
Dialogue: Leave her.

Speaker: murdoch
Dialogue: Forget it. I've seen this before. There's nothing you can do.

Speaker: murdoch
Dialogue: You're wasting your time.

Speaker: murdoch
Dialogue: Punks.

Speaker: murdoch
Dialogue: I told you you were wasting your time. Once these kids go rabid, best thing to do is put 'em down.

Speaker: murdoch
Dialogue: Dead serious. See... the world is made up of rules. Kids don't like rules. They rebel for a while, but ultimately they start to fall in line and become ordinary Joe's like you and me. But some kids... dope smokers mainly, watching their MTV... Satanic lyrics melting what's left of their brains... these kids grow up to be punks. And when these punks step as far over the line as these "Freddy" punks have -- then we as peace officers have no choice but to kill them.

Speaker: murdoch
Dialogue: Punks. There's a difference...  ...barely.

Speaker: miss krepps
Dialogue: Meagan!?

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Yes, ma'am?

Speaker: miss krepps
Dialogue: I asked if you were ready to give your oral report?

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Yes... I'm ready.

Speaker: miss krepps
Dialogue: Please come up here to the podium.

Speaker: miss krepps
Dialogue: You won't think it's funny when you haven't learned the fundamentals of a free market economy... oh, why do I waste my breath? You're all going to grow up to be gas station attendants and waitresses anyway. Go ahead, Meagan.

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: My report is on Global Economic Trends.  Try and think of a world where there is no poverty... no sickness... no crime. A world where everyone is happy to be alive and everyone lives together in peace. This is my dream.

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: This dream is becoming a reality with ever-growing international business...

Speaker: miss krepps
Dialogue: Louder, Meagan. We can't hear you.

Speaker: miss krepps
Dialogue: Louder, Meagan... we still can't hear you.

Speaker: freddy
Dialogue: Aww... all dressed up and nowhere to blow!

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Jesse... please, help me.

Speaker: freddy
Dialogue: Looks like a photo opportunity to me!

Speaker: freddy
Dialogue: Say... cheesecake!

Speaker: miss krepps
Dialogue: Meagan? Meagan?!

Speaker: miss krepps
Dialogue: I asked if you were ready to give your report?

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Sure...

Speaker: school nurse
Dialogue: Meagan? Can you hear me? Do you know where you are?

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: I was day dreaming and then I woke up but then it was like I was still dreaming and then I woke up and then I guess I fainted and now I'm awake again...

Speaker: school nurse
Dialogue: Are you sure?

Speaker: school nurse
Dialogue: Meagan?

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: I'm waiting to see if you're going to turn into Freddy.

Speaker: school nurse
Dialogue: Freddy... I see. You've been watching too much CNN. That crazy "Freddy" cult thing -- it's all over the TV day and night -- you can't get away from it. No wonder you kids are all having nightmares.

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: But this one was different... it felt real.

Speaker: school nurse
Dialogue: But that's just it, Meagan... dreams aren't real. They're just broken fragments of the subconscious mind.

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Fear is real though, isn't it? And if nightmares are fear, then doesn't that make them real?!  And if the nightmares are real then is reality like a dream?!

Speaker: school nurse
Dialogue: Meagan! You've got heat prostration... that's all.

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Old witch... what does she know? She isn't even qualified to give a shot and she's telling me that my dreams aren't anything to worry about.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: So she said you were okay?

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Oh, sure... Madame Curie in there says it's just a case of heat pro- stration and an overdose of TV news. Ruined my makeup, too.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: So you're going back to class?

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: No. She gave me last period off.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Well, what are you bitching about? I could have a compound fracture of the skull and she wouldn't excuse me from P.E.

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Jesse! I've been having nightmares for almost two weeks now and they keep getting worse! Now I'm having daymares! I want to know why!

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Okay... well, didn't the nurse say it was heat probation?

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: You don't understand... I want to know more about dreams. What they mean... why we have them.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Okay, Meg, go look it up. You've got the rest of the day off, that's all I'm saying.

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: That's a good idea. Why don't you cut last period and come with me?

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Sure. Where are we going?

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: The library.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: You want me to cut school so we can go to the library?

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Find anything?

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: What? Oh, no... nothing yet.

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Did you know that our sub-conscious retains everything that ever happened to us? Everything. From the time we're born until we die.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Really?

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: That's how Freddy gets at us... by using our sub-conscious fears. Fears our conscious minds have repressed or forgotten.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: I've got a news flash for you... Freddy's dead.

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: I'm not so sure... if Freddy exists in our sub-conscious then he can never be fully erased. Like a bad memory... you may blot it out of your mind but it will alway be hiding someplace in your dreams.  Weren't you scared as a child by something so stupid that you're ashamed to admit it?

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: No?

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Well, yeah.

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Well, what? What is it?

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Well... when I was kid, my brother took me to the carnival. And in the penny arcade there was this robot gunslinger...

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Black Bart.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: You know about Black Bart?

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Duh. You put your quarter in and he says, "Go ahead and draw, tenderfoot." And then you pull your gun out and shoot him.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: That's just it -- I never could! I'd point the gun right at him and shoot, and I could never hit the guy. So I always got killed.

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: No one can hit him -- it's a gyp.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Scared the shit out of me.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Isn't that scary? I mean... for a kid?

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Okay, smartass... what about you? What scared you the most as a kid?

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: I remember... Lizzy wandered off one day and we couldn't find her. The police came and everything. I wasn't really worried until I saw her picture on TV... then I got really scared.  Jesse, I can't explain it... but I think something bad's going to happen.

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: You're stupid!

Speaker: lizzy
Dialogue: No, you are!

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: They forgot you again!

Speaker: lizzy
Dialogue: No, they didn't!

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: Yes, they forgot and you're goin' to wait out here until it's dark and then the monsters are goin' come and get you!

Speaker: lizzy
Dialogue: No they won't, because I'm walkin' home!

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: Come back, Lizzy! You can wait with me! I got forgot too, you know!

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: Okay... I'm going to have to report this!

Speaker: meagan's dad
Dialogue: Didn't you get my message?

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: What message?

Speaker: meagan's dad
Dialogue: I called the school after lunch... I had to stay late after work... I...

Speaker: meagan's mom
Dialogue: Don't you dare blame this on her, you sorry bastard! It's all your fault!  Where have you been anyway?

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: The library.

Speaker: meagan's mom
Dialogue: A likely Goddamn story!

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Dad... what's wrong? What's happened? Where's Lizzy?

Speaker: meagan's dad
Dialogue: She didn't come home from school today. The police got a report that a girl fitting Lizzy's description was forced into a car by some crazies. They're pretty sure it was this "Freddy" cult.

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Oh, my God...

Speaker: meagan's dad
Dialogue: Now don't worry. The police are doing everything they can.

Speaker: trooper
Dialogue: Hey, Cap'n... better have a look up here!

Speaker: trooper
Dialogue: Looks like she was in the cult all along.

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: No... no, she wouldn't do that! Lizzy wouldn't join Freddy's cult!

Speaker: trooper
Dialogue: I know it's hard to believe, miss. But a lot of good kids get caught up in this kind of trouble.

Speaker: murdoch
Dialogue: Punks...

Speaker: meagan's dad
Dialogue: Captain Murdoch... is there any- thing we can do?

Speaker: murdoch
Dialogue: You can pray, sir. Pray we find your daughter before... well, before it's too late. But rest assured, if I can't persuade her to come back to her loving home, then I'll do what's best for her. I know you and your wife wouldn't want her to suffer.  Come on... I want to go talk to Erwin.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Where are we going?

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Over to Stormie's.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Stormie? I thought you and her weren't friends anymore since she stole that twenty dollars from you.

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: That was her "klepto" phase... when she was dating that gang member. She dumped him a long time ago.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: I still don't understand. What has she got to do with Lizzy missing?

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: She used to be in the Freddy cult. Maybe she knows where they took Lizzy.

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: If I did know I would call the police, you know that. I love Lizzy. No telling what those freaks will do to her. Those Freddy cult guys are hard core.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: I thought you were in the cult?

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: I was in the cult for a week cause my boyfriend at the time... Slasher, he was. But I just liked the music and the clothes... when they were clean, but not like the violence and stuff. But that was just my "cult" phase... but I got past that. You know, just like my "gang" phase when I was dating Ramon and then before that was my "death rock" phase when I was dating Stuart...

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Uh, excuse me... but what phase are we in now?

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: Militant feminist, man-hating phase, what's it fuckin' to ya?!

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Why don't you just let the cops find her? That guy Renton Murdoch -- he knows how to deal with these cultist psychos. He was the man who got Jason Voorhees.

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: That guy in my dreams...

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: Jason kicked his ass.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Well... yeah. But Murdoch put thirteen bullets in Jason before he hacked his head open.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: But even with his head hacked open and his brains leaking out, Murdoch still managed to put his last bullet in Jason's eye.

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: Well, one of my mom's boyfriends worked at the hospital where they took him. He said that Murdoch lost more than half his brain and what little that was left was all twisted up inside. And they had to replace his skull with a metal plate to keep that from leaking out.

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: They say he hasn't been the same since.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: So what's different about him?

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: One thing... he used to be a Democrat. Now he votes straight Republican.

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: I think he thinks Lizzy joined the cult or something.

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: Oh, my God... he'll kill her.

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: I've got to find Lizzy myself. I've got to find her and save her from Freddy before that crazy cop kills her.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Just where are you going to look? I mean, these cult guys could be holding her anywhere.

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Murdoch said something about going to talk to somebody named Erwin.

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: Erwin Kelper! He used to be in the Freddy cult! I bet he knows where they took Lizzy!

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Not Squirmin' Erwin -- that freak that used to eat bugs?

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: Erwin is scary smart -- always brought home "A"s -- but he was kinda fucked up, too... I mean, who isn't really? Anyway, he quit the cult a few months back and the cops put him away for his own safety. They say Freddy's put a death hex on Erwin.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: A death hex?

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: Yes, a death hex. You know... where someone wants you dead!

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Where is he?

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: I want you to stay here.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Why?

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Don't be mad... it's just that you might scare him.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Scare him?

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: What she's subtly trying to tell you is that this needs a woman's gentle touch... butthead.

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Just stay here... okay?

Speaker: security guard
Dialogue: Yo, Erwin... you've got a couple of visitors. Now be a good boy...  You've got five minutes. I'll be right down the hall if you need me.

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Erwin...?

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: SHOW ME YOUR ARMS! YOUR ARMS!

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: Where do you shoot?

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Shoot?

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: He's talking about dream dope -- the stuff the cultists shoot up with so they can talk to Freddy.

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: I don't do drugs.

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: You're not in the cult?

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: Didn't Freddy send you to kill me?

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: I don't trust you... better take off your clothes so I can check you for tracks.

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: Chill, Erwin. We're here for some hard data -- not a floppy disk.

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: Well, what do you want? Can't you see I'm busy?

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Freddy's cult kidnapped my sister.

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: I told her you might know where they took her.

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: I already told the cops everything I know.

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Tell me... please.

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: Look... I'm sorry about your sister, but I've got my own problems with Freddy. I'm a marked man, you know.

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Then tell me why they took her...

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: To bear his child. Freddy wants to be human again. In order to do that he has to be "reborn".

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: How can he do that?

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: He has to marry a virgin on holy ground. Then the cult consumate the marriage by impregnating her.

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: The whole cult? Yeech!

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: Freddy's the son of a hundred maniacs. It's sort of a tradition with him.

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: So the cult gets Lizzy pregnant?

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: And Freddy enters the soul of the fetus through a dream state. Voila! Rebirth.

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: That's the stupidest shit I ever heard.

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: Hey, they're not my rules... some- body else wrote 'em.

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Erwin... you've got to help me find Lizzy. You're my only hope.

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: I'll help you find your sister, but you've got to help me.

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Anything. Just name it.

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: You have to help me kill Freddy.

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: But Freddy's dead.

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: Freddy lives...  If only in our dreams.

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: Come on, Meagan... our five minutes is up. He's giving me the creeps.

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: How can you kill a dream?

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: When it's not a dream.  Do we have a deal?

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Deal.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: No! I won't do it!

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Come on, Jesse! Please...?

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: It's illegal! I could go to jail!

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: How will they ever know? Don't be such a pussy!

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Oh, yeah? Why don't you call then?

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: Okay, I will!

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: No! They'll never believe her!

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: I can disguise my voice...  Hello, how do you do? My name is Jesse. I think I'm a man but I'm actually a wimp.

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: They'll never believe that. Come on, Jesse... for me?

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Okay... okay... I'll do it.  And I'm not a wimp!

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: I need a quarter for the phone.

Speaker: security guard
Dialogue: Springwood Mental Center... how can I help you?

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: There's a bomb planted in your building.

Speaker: security guard
Dialogue: Who is this?

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: If I were you -- I'd get my ass out of there.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Oh, yeah... Freddy Lives.

Speaker: security guard
Dialogue: Hey, Erwin... where do you think you're going?

Speaker: security guard
Dialogue: I'm talking to you, asshole!

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: He's not going to make it.

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: We've got to do something!

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: Hi, my name's Erwin. Thanks for busting me out of there!

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Yeah, right... Look, Erwin, just do me one favor -- don't eat nothing disgusting. My stomach is tight enough as it is.

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: Damn! We must have just missed them!

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Oh, my God -- she was here! This is part of Lizzy's shirt! It's all torn!  Erwin... we've got to find her!

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: We're too late! There's no way... except...

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Except what?!

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: We could go after Freddy.

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: How?

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: We'll inject ourselves with Dream Dope.  It's a mild narcotic that brings on a dreamlike state.

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Okay... let's do it!

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Meagan... we don't do drugs! I mean, what if one of us gets hooked or something?  We could turn out like him!

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: Don't worry about it. We need you wide awake anyway.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: What for?

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: We're going to go under and try to find Freddy. When we do, we'll grab him and bring him here. Then you kill him with this...

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: This rusty chunk of shit? What good is this?

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: It's not the gun, it's what's in it -- silver bullets blessed by a priest.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Will that work?

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: Should. But then...

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: You don't make the rules... yeah, yeah.

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: What should we do?

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: Have a seat over there and make yourselves comfortable. Roll up your sleeves and put these on...

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: Oh, cool!

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: What are they for?

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: It's how the cult keeps in constant contact with Freddy. The little lights flashing are a sustained occular input that causes your brain to resonate at approximately the same frequency at which the dream state is most likely to occur.

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: Whatever...  Put 'em on -- they're really cool!

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: It helps to hold hands if you want to go together...

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: And remember... Freddy knows what scares you.

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: WHAT A RUSH, HUH?!!

Speaker: lizzy
Dialogue: Meagan... help me... please...

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: Freddy's trying to split us up...

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Okay, Freddy... there's a new sheriff in Dreamland now.

Speaker: freddy
Dialogue: Looking for some-body?

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: I've got him! Wake us up! Wake us up!

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: Don't just stand there! Wake us up!

Speaker: freddy
Dialogue: Hmmmmm... I feel like seafood tonight.

Speaker: freddy
Dialogue: Stew on this, bitch!

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: Shoot him! Shoot him!

Speaker: freddy
Dialogue: Well, well, well... if it isn't my ol' pal, Erwin.

Speaker: freddy
Dialogue: I've got something special in mind for you...

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: You didn't help me, you pussy! I could've had him!  You gutless... spinless... jelly fish!

Speaker: lizzy
Dialogue: Meagan... help me... Meagan...

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Daddy?

Speaker: meagan's dad
Dialogue: Shuuuuu! I'm trying to be invisible...

Speaker: lizzy
Dialogue: Help me...

Speaker: lizzy
Dialogue: Meagan...

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: Are you okay?

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: He got away... I had him and he got away. Oh, God... Lizzy... I lost her...

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: Well, atleast you're not dead.

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: No... I'm not dead...  No... I'm not. But Freddy killed me!

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: He killed me, too. But look...

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Now that I think about it -- he's killed me in all my nightmares. But I'm not dead... what does it mean?

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: It means we've still got some time left. Until his remains are host to the Dream Demons -- Freddy can't hurt us.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Hello. The Dream Demons...?

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: Freddy made a pact with Satan when he died... so Satan bestowed upon him the Dream Demons. They're the source of Freddy's power to manipulate our physical reality. Without them... he's powerless -- nothing more than a bad dream.  Hey, like I said... I don't make the rules.

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: But we've still got a chance, right? A chance to kill Freddy before he gets back his power?

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: We already tried that. There's no way for us to kill Freddy. He's too clever. He knows how to get to us.

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Then let's get somebody else. Some- body strong.

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: Yeah! We could hire somebody to kill Freddy -- like a hit man!

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: You would have to hire a thousand of them... or one really big guy who isn't afraid of anything. No fear. Nada. Then you got a shot.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Where are you going to find a hit man? The yellow pages? In your dreams...

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Jason...

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Jason?

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Jason Voorhees...

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: Jason Voorhees... that's brilliant! The perfect dream warrior... no fear.

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: Sounds like our man!

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Uh... excuse me, Einstein... but isn't Jason Voorhees dead?

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: Seriously dead. Buried up by Crystal Lake somewhere. But don't worry, I know how to bring him back to life.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Somehow I just knew you would.

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: But that's not the problem. The problem is control. Once we bring Jason back from the dead... I'm not one hundred percent sure he'll do what we tell him.

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: Well, that's okay... as long as he doesn't chop us all up.

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Erwin... I'm trusting you on this, so tell me the truth. Do you think if we do this -- if we go and get Jason and bring him back to life, that he could kill Freddy?

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: No doubt about. Jason could wreck Freddy on this side of the Dreamline. But if Freddy has home court advan- tage... I don't know. Too close to call. The trick would be to get Jason to enter a dream state, grab Freddy, and drag him out to our reality.

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: I haven't got a choice. I've got to try something...  I can't ask either of you to help me do this... it's illegal, immoral, disgusting...

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: Hey, we sisters have to stand together, right? Where you lead -- I'll follow. Count me in.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Let me get this straight... we're going to go dig one dead maniac up to fight another dead maniac?

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: That's about the size of it... and I'd be doing you a disservice if I said there weren't a modicum of risk involved.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Meagan... I don't want to do this...

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: You don't have to, Jesse... it's not your fight. I understand.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: But I damn sure don't want you to do it without me. Count me in.

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: Look out Freddy... here we come.

Speaker: night watchman
Dialogue: What's matter, girl... you hear somethin'?

Speaker: night watchman
Dialogue: What's this? A funeral procession?

Speaker: cultist
Dialogue: That's exactly what it is.

Speaker: night watchman
Dialogue: Yeah? Whose?

Speaker: cultist
Dialogue: Yours.

Speaker: freddy
Dialogue: Smokin'!

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: We're almost there...

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: We should pull over and ask directions.

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: If it doesn't offend the men... ooops, sorry! There aren't any.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Very funny.

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: I don't think they're open.

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: It says, open all night.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Hey! Can we get some service out here?!

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: I don't think there's anybody here...

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: We're looking for the old cemetery that's supposed to be around here... somewhere.

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: We want to see it.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Look, mister... can you give us directions or not?

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Stupid? Like what?

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Jesus... why would anyone do that?

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: Been dug up a few times already, has he?

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Well, we're just doing an article for our high school newspaper about the dangers of breaking into cemeteries at night. You know, stuff that can get you hurt...

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: What's the story on Jason Voorhees anyway?

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: Where have you been? Jason was that guy who ran around in a hockey mask, chopping up camp counselors, duh?

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: I knew that. What I mean was why?

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: It started a long time ago, back in the fifties, when Jason drown at Camp Crystal Lake. His mother went berserk and started killing the counselors.

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: She got her head chopped off by one of the girls she was trying to kill!

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: Right. And then Jason came back from his watery grave to get revenge.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: He came back from the grave?

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: Yeah. Chopped up a number of people before they finally caught up to him.

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: What happened to him then?

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: They killed him.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: How can you kill somebody who's back from the grave?

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: Not very well apparently. Jason keeps coming back to life and chopping people up. It's a never ending cycle of terror up here at Crystal Lake -- a real problem.

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Why does he keep coming back to life and killing people?

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: They say he's looking for revenge on the camp counselor who murdered him as a child. Jason just happens to go about it in the socially unacceptable way of hacking through every teenager he finds until he gets the right one.  Here it is...

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: Look... the boogerman!  Get it?!

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: Get back, you nasty-ass bastard! Ug! I thought I had seen the last of those when my brother graduated third grade!

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: We just dug up a rotting corpse and you're worried about a little snot.

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: I'm exhausted... wake me when we get back home.

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: Uhhh... better not fall asleep -- we've still got a lot of work to do and Freddy's out there... waiting.

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: Well, that means we've all got to stay awake!

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Duh?!

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: I know! We'll sing a song!  Row! Row! Row your boat, gently down the stream. Merrily, merrily, merrily, merrily... life is but a dream. Come on, everybody!

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: ...merrily, merrily, merrily, merrily... life is but a dream.

Speaker: freddy
Dialogue: Shouldn't dream and drive.

Speaker: freddy
Dialogue: Looks like the cat's out of the bag now!

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: It's Freddy!

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Jesse's hurt real bad... we've got to get him to a doctor.

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: Don't worry... an ambulance is on the way.

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Oh, God... Jesse...

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: Meagan... listen to me... The cops are on their way. If they find me and Jason Voorhees in the trunk there, we're finished.

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Go... get out of here. Take Jason and Stormie with you.

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: I'm staying with you.

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: I'll call you at the hospital.

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: How?

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: Somehow!

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Is he going to be okay?

Speaker: doctor
Dialogue: Yes. But he needs a lot of rest. His leg is broken in four places and he has four broken ribs and a concussion.

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: Hey doc, is there someplace I could get us something to eat?

Speaker: doctor
Dialogue: I'm afraid the cafeteria is closed. There are some vending machines in the lobby.  I'll be back to check on him in a couple of hours.

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: I'll be right back... I'm goin' go score us some munchies.

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Jesse!

Speaker: freddy
Dialogue: Okay, Sheriff... This nightmare ain't big enough for the two of us... draw!

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Jesse! Wake up! Wake up!!

Speaker: freddy
Dialogue: Three's a crowd, bitch! Why don't you just go get [BEEP]

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Jesse, wake up! WAKE UP!!

Speaker: freddy
Dialogue: Go ahead... make my dream!

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Freddy killed Jesse...

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: Jesus... get a grip, lady. You'd think a nurse in a hospital would have seen a dead body before.

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Jesse...

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: Attention. Would Meagan or Stormie please pick up the white paging phone for a message?

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: This is Stormie...

Speaker: murdoch
Dialogue: Did you see a couple of girls go by here a moment ago?

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: Just missed 'em.

Speaker: hospital operator
Dialogue: The message is from Erwin... he says to meet him at the side entrance in two minutes.

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: Where'd you get the truck?

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: Same place I've got Jason hid.

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: And where's that?

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: A place where no one ever goes.

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: What'd you do -- take him for a swim?

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: Almost.

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: Is she going to be alright?

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: I don't know. She's pretty fucked up. God, I don't know why I'm not...

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: You're a strong woman.

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: What's that supposed to mean?

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: Uhhh... nothing. I didn't mean anything.

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: Is this him?

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: Yeah...  Meet the new and improved Jason.

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: Why'd you put that stupid mask on him?

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: Take a look...

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: Good idea.

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: Not exactly a beauty queen entry, is he?

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: So what do we do now -- sing an Ozzy Osbourne song backwards or something?

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: I'm afraid it's not that simple...

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: I thought you said you knew how to bring him back to life?

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: I do! But when I was putting him back together, I noticed something was missing.

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: Awwww, he won't be needing that... I mean, what girl would let him put his rotten ol'...

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: No-no! Not that! It's his heart... it's missing.

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: Well... does it really matter? Can't you use an aquarium pump or something?

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: No... he has to have a heart. A human heart. A good one.

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: I know where we can get a heart... A good one.

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: That guard in there might pose a problem.

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Do you think you and Stormie could keep him occupied for a few minutes?

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Okay... let's do it.

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: Hey! Watch that!

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: I'm just trying to make it look real.

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: Just keep your hands above the bra, pizza face.

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Forgive me, Jesse...

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: He's head right for her! Do some- thing!

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: Stop right there!

Speaker: murdoch
Dialogue: Teenagers are notorious liars.

Speaker: murdoch
Dialogue: You did the right thing.

Speaker: murdoch
Dialogue: Did the guard say what they took?

Speaker: murdoch
Dialogue: No... that won't be necessary. I know just where they're going, and just what they're up to. And this time... I'll be ready.

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: You've got to quit blaming your- self for what happened to Jesse... it wasn't your fault.

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: He didn't want to come with us... but he did anyway. He did it for me.

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: I'm not sorry I came... I don't think Jesse would be, either.

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: I just can't believe he's dead. I keep thinking he'll show up any minute...

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: Well, that just about does it...

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: As you can see, I've excavated the power cable that runs across the bottom of Crystal Lake. I've cut away the insulation, exposing a patch of cable right near the water's edge.

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: Now when I kick this over, the water will wash down the trench and bridge an eletrical gap between the cable and the lake. There's plenty of voltage, so it should work.

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: So you kick the bucket and Jason lives.

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: Yeah, right...  Okay, keep your fingers crossed...

Speaker: jason's father
Dialogue: Jason! Git your ass over here!

Speaker: jason's father
Dialogue: What did I teach you, boy? Don't ever take your mask off out in public. I don't want nobody to see that ugly mug of yours.

Speaker: jason's father
Dialogue: Go git in the woodshed.

Speaker: jason's father
Dialogue: Drop them overalls and lay over them logs...

Speaker: jason's mother
Dialogue: Jason! Come here!

Speaker: jason's father
Dialogue: What are you doing woman?

Speaker: jason's mother
Dialogue: I saved up some money... I want you to take and go on up to that summer camp just up the road. Tell the man you want to stay there.

Speaker: jason's father
Dialogue: Just what the hell do you think you're doing, bitch?!

Speaker: jason's mother
Dialogue: I'm sending him away for a few weeks.

Speaker: jason's father
Dialogue: You ain't sending him nowhere.  Bring me that money, boy!

Speaker: jason's mother
Dialogue: Go on now... go!

Speaker: jason's father
Dialogue: Goin' ag'in me? I'll take you to the shed, woman!

Speaker: jason's mother
Dialogue: You ain't ever taking anyone to the shed ever again.

Speaker: jason's mother
Dialogue: Go on, son... have a good time! Mommy will come and git you some day soon!

Speaker: head counselor
Dialogue: Welcome aboard, son! I'm sure you'll have a great time!

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: Holy shit! It worked!

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: It's kill him! Shut it off! Shut it off!

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: Shut it off... it suddenly occurs to me that I hadn't really planned for that contingency.

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: Just don't stand there! Do something!

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Jason! JASON! You've got to get up! Do you hear me? Get up!

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: Well... it's off now.

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: Hey! Come back! I've got him locked up in the tool shed!

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Who are you calling?!

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: The cops! Who else?!

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Are you kidding?! They'll lock us up and throw away the key!

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: Fine by me!  Damnit! It's dead!

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: He's right behind me!

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: You're the one who brought him back to life!

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: And?!

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: Well, do something!

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: Oh, some hero!

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: STOP!

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Now... just stop! We're the ones that brought you back to life. And you have no right to kill us with that chainsaw! In fact... you owe us...

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: That's right! She gave you her boyfriend's heart, you know!

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: That's right.

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Look! Here's his picture...

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Now, I know that you've been through a lot. And I know that you're pissed off about being murdered and all.

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: I know I would be!

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: But if you help us kill Freddy Krueger... I promise to help you find the little bastard that killed you. What do you say? Have we got a deal?

Speaker: murdoch
Dialogue: Three!

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Jason, you have to hide! Stay in here and don't come out until we tell you. Stormie... help me!

Speaker: murdoch
Dialogue: Alright... anybody else left in there had better say their prayers!

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: There's no one else inside.

Speaker: murdoch
Dialogue: Is that a fact?  Okay... you had your chance!

Speaker: cop
Dialogue: Hey, look!

Speaker: murdoch
Dialogue: I knew it!

Speaker: murdoch
Dialogue: Stand back! I'll handle this.

Speaker: murdoch
Dialogue: You...

Speaker: murdoch
Dialogue: Let her go.

Speaker: murdoch
Dialogue: That'll teach you to fuck with the law, Voorhees!

Speaker: cop
Dialogue: Uhh, sir... your hat's on fire.

Speaker: curious cop
Dialogue: Hey... do you see that?

Speaker: partner
Dialogue: See what?

Speaker: curious cop
Dialogue: I thought I saw something...

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: We've got to try and stay awake.

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: Getting something to eat might help.  Yo, Butch!

Speaker: deputy miller
Dialogue: It's Deputy Miller.

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: Excuse me, Deputy Miller but could we have something to eat?

Speaker: deputy miller
Dialogue: I thought you psychos only ate human hearts?

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: And I thought you pigs only ate donuts.

Speaker: deputy miller
Dialogue: Don't make me come back there.

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: Cow! I hope she chokes on her three combo-burrito cud!

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: What am I going to do? I'll never be able to find Lizzy now.

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: You should be worrying about your- self... I know I am.

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: I bet you're sorry you came with me now...

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: Nah... what are best friends for? Afterall, you stuck by me through all my crazy phases, I figure I owe you one big crazy phase, right?

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: That's for being my best friend, Stormie.

Speaker: deputy miller
Dialogue: Come on, Meagan.

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Where are we going?

Speaker: deputy miller
Dialogue: Your parents are here.

Speaker: meagan's mom
Dialogue: Oh, Meagan... are you alright? Let me look at you...

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: I'm okay, mom.

Speaker: meagan's dad
Dialogue: Your mother's been worried sick, Meagan. So have I.

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Sorry. Today has been a bitch.

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: Help! Help! Freddy's here! He's here!

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: Oh, shit! I'm still asleep!

Speaker: freddy
Dialogue: You know what they say... when you sleep -- you die!

Speaker: meagan's mom
Dialogue: Meagan, Captain Murdoch here said you helped one of those cultists escape from a hospital?

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: A mental hospital.

Speaker: meagan's mom
Dialogue: And he said you desecrated a cemetery and some other really terrible things. Tell me you had nothing to do with it. Tell me there's some mistake...?

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: There's no mistake.  What did you do with Erwin?

Speaker: murdoch
Dialogue: Your boyfriend is headed back to the looney bin where he belongs. But don't worry, you'll be seeing him soon enough... at the arraignment.

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: You don't scare me, Freddy! Thanks to my various phases and many hours of watching violent televison, I have become immune to violence. Seen it all and done it all! Nothing you do can gross me out -- so why don't you give it your best shot, bitch!

Speaker: freddy
Dialogue: Then maybe I'll just CUT to the chase!

Speaker: stormie
Dialogue: I'm warning you, Freddy... my father is a drill sergeant in the Marine Corps and he taught me just how to defend myself against slimy bastards like you.

Speaker: freddy
Dialogue: Oh I'm so scared, honey. Come on! Hit me! Punch me right in the nose! I dare you!

Speaker: freddy
Dialogue: Owwwww!

Speaker: freddy
Dialogue: Now that's what I call getting a buzz.

Speaker: boogerman
Dialogue: Hi there! I'm the Boogerman! Heh- heh... get it?

Speaker: boogerman
Dialogue: Aww, don't go... we can play "Star Wars". You can be Princess Leia and I'll be Jabba the Hutt!

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: We're wasting time! We've got to close down all the churches -- Freddy has to marry Lizzy on holy ground!

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Don't you understand?! He has to come to our reality to do it! It's our last chance to kill him!

Speaker: murdoch
Dialogue: Okay, I think we've heard enough of this crap. Take her back to the lockup.

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Dad! Mom! Don't let them lock me up! I have to save Lizzy!

Speaker: meagan's mom
Dialogue: Oh, Meagan... you're sick. You don't even realize what you've done.

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: I did what I had to do to try and save Lizzy!

Speaker: murdoch
Dialogue: Yeah, including murdering your boy- friend and cutting his heart out.

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Liar! Freddy killed Jesse! He was already dead when I cut his heart out!

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Goddamnit, you don't understand! Freddy lives! FREDDY LIVES!!!

Speaker: murdoch
Dialogue: I know how you must feel... I had a dog once. I loved that dog. I treated her like my own daughter. We went camping, picnics in the park... I even had a little stocking for her nailed up on the mantle for Christmas. Then one day, she bit me... so I had to blow her brains out.  God, I loved that dog.

Speaker: boogerman
Dialogue: Uh-oh, Freddy's picking his nose again -- gotta go!

Speaker: boogerman
Dialogue: Well, excuse me!

Speaker: freddy
Dialogue: Ahhh... ahhh... ahhh--CHOO!

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Stormie?!

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Oh, God... what have I done? What have I done?!

Speaker: ambulance driver
Dialogue: I'll go check it out. You stay here.

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: You... want me to tell you where Meagan is?

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: You're not, are you?

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: Okay... okay! I'll take you right to her. Could you help me out of this?

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: I'll drive.

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: Okay... you drive.

Speaker: computer voice
Dialogue: Fasten your safety belt, please.

Speaker: computer voice
Dialogue: Fasten your safety belt, please... Fasten your safety belt, please...

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: Fuck the bitch. Let's roll!

Speaker: religious announcer
Dialogue: This is Channel 12 -- Station W.G.O.D. -- where the "W" stands for "Worship" And now... "Daily Affirmation" with Reverend Lawrence Lovejoy...

Speaker: reverend lovejoy
Dialogue: Good morning, friends... the Good Book says that each morning brings a new light into our lives...

Speaker: religious announcer
Dialogue: You can own a videotape of Reverend Lovejoy's Daily Affirmation for only

Speaker: gate guard
Dialogue: Hello. What can I do for you?

Speaker: cultist
Dialogue: We're here to see the Reverend Lovejoy. We need him to perform a wedding.

Speaker: gate guard
Dialogue: Do you have an appointment?

Speaker: cultist
Dialogue: No. I have a Beretta.

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Something just happened at the TV station.

Speaker: deputy
Dialogue: Don't worry about it -- get undressed.

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: What for?

Speaker: deputy
Dialogue: Time to get you cleaned up for court.

Speaker: head bitch
Dialogue: What's the matter, honey... you don't like our company?

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: I like you... sure. It's just that I usually shower alone, that's all.

Speaker: head bitch
Dialogue: Oh! So you're shy? I like 'em when they're shy...

Speaker: head bitch
Dialogue: Don't fight it, baby! You know you want me...

Speaker: head bitch
Dialogue: If you won't give me a piece then I'll just cut one for myself...

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Wait a second... I didn't mean to do that... I'm sorry. It's just that you come on a little strong, that's all. Just give me a little time to adjust to my new surroundings...

Speaker: head bitch
Dialogue: Are you saying you want me now?

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Yes... I want you.

Speaker: head bitch
Dialogue: Prove it.

Speaker: head bitch
Dialogue: Hey, this bitch is alright!

Speaker: head bitch
Dialogue: You're okay, honey... what's your name?

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Meagan.

Speaker: head bitch
Dialogue: So... what're you in for, Meagan?

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Oh, my friend...

Speaker: head bitch
Dialogue: The bitch that died last night?

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Yeah... they said she had some disease that made her... explode! Oh, God! Please hold me!

Speaker: head bitch
Dialogue: Easy... honey. It's goin' be alright. But what I asked you is why you're in here?

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Oh... well... the cops? Well, they think I gave it to her...

Speaker: deputy
Dialogue: What the hell is all the screaming about?!

Speaker: murdoch
Dialogue: Punks...

Speaker: junior trooper
Dialogue: Hey, that's Captain Murdoch's car!

Speaker: reverend lovejoy
Dialogue: I won't do it! It's a sin! Blasphemy!

Speaker: cultist
Dialogue: Wedding or funeral... your choice.

Speaker: reverend lovejoy
Dialogue: And who would be the bride?

Speaker: lizzy
Dialogue: One... two... Freddy's coming for you.

Speaker: lizzy
Dialogue: Three... four... Better lock your door.

Speaker: reverend lovejoy
Dialogue: And the groom.

Speaker: cultist
Dialogue: He's coming...

Speaker: lizzy
Dialogue: Five... six... grab your crucifix...

Speaker: freddy
Dialogue: That's for the lift sister!  Hiya, kids!

Speaker: cultists
Dialogue: Hiya, Freddy!

Speaker: freddy
Dialogue: Ready to get hitched?

Speaker: cultists
Dialogue: Ready, Freddy!

Speaker: freddy
Dialogue: Then let's do it!

Speaker: lizzy
Dialogue: I love you, Freddy...

Speaker: deputy
Dialogue: We found your patrol car, Captain. It was abandoned near a local religious station.

Speaker: murdoch
Dialogue: Religious station? Is there a padre there?

Speaker: deputy
Dialogue: Yes, sir. Reverend Lovejoy broad- casts out of that location.

Speaker: murdoch
Dialogue: So that's where they're hiding.

Speaker: reverend lovejoy
Dialogue: ...and if there be anyone among you who has any reason why these two should not be joined in holy...

Speaker: reverend lovejoy
Dialogue: ...or forever hold their peace.

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Stop!

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Take me, Freddy. Take me instead.

Speaker: freddy
Dialogue: You're a virgin?!

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Oh, that's right -- tell everybody!

Speaker: freddy
Dialogue: Mmmmmmm! Yes, you are a bit juicier than your retard sister... okay, you've got the job.  Get her ready.

Speaker: murdoch
Dialogue: This is Captain Renton Murdoch -- State Trooper. I'm giving you until the count of three to come out with your hands up...

Speaker: murdoch
Dialogue: Hand me that flare pistol.

Speaker: murdoch
Dialogue: Alright, now I'm through playing "nice guy" -- I want the rest of you punks to come out right now with your hands up.

Speaker: murdoch
Dialogue: What we're going to need then is somebody to charge their lines -- make a hole for us to slip in.

Speaker: murdoch
Dialogue: Here comes one now...  GO GIT 'EM, SON!

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: That was easy enough...

Speaker: reverend lovejoy
Dialogue: Once again... if there be anyone among you who does not want these two people to be joined... let him speak now or forever hold his peace.

Speaker: freddy
Dialogue: Uh, oh...

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: I can't wake them up. Freddy's got them trapped!

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: Go get him, boy!

Speaker: ted bundy
Dialogue: Ladies and gentlemen... welcome to the fight of the century! I'm your ring announcer... Ted Bundy!

Speaker: ted bundy
Dialogue: Verrrrrry funny, Oswald!

Speaker: oswald
Dialogue: It wasn't me!

Speaker: ted bundy
Dialogue: In my left corner, weighing in at only ninety seven pounds... the nightmare master himself! The one! The only... Freddddddddy Kruuuuuuugerrrrrr!!!

Speaker: ted bundy
Dialogue: Jason Voorhees!

Speaker: ted bundy
Dialogue: And the prize tonight... not one but TWO -- count 'em -- TWO virgins... ripe for the picking.

Speaker: ted bundy
Dialogue: Hey, have one now and save the other for the ride home. That's what I did.

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Kick his ass, Jason!

Speaker: bloody mary
Dialogue: HEY!

Speaker: freddy
Dialogue: Oh, well... I just axed for that!

Speaker: hitler
Dialogue: Peasants...

Speaker: human head
Dialogue: That's it, kiddo! You're really giving it to him out there! Use the left more -- jab! Make him hurt! That's the ticket to a knockout!

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Jason! Get up! Get up!

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Jason! You've got to get up!

Speaker: freddy
Dialogue: Oh, shit!

Speaker: murdoch
Dialogue: Now's my chance... give me sixty seconds to get in there then move in.

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: What took you so long?!

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: What ever you do... don't let this guy drive.

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: I knew you would come...

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: Oh, no! Freddy's in the transmitter!

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: He's going for the satellite dish! If he uplinks with a communications satellite he can beam himself any- where in the world! We'll never be rid of him!

Speaker: erwin
Dialogue: No! Wait!

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Erwin? Erwin?!

Speaker: murdoch
Dialogue: He's dead... and so are you if you don't put your hands up right now!

Speaker: murdoch
Dialogue: It's time I taught you girls some respect for the law!

Speaker: murdoch
Dialogue: So... you wanna be a punk?

Speaker: murdoch
Dialogue: Then die like a punk!

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: NO!

Speaker: lizzy
Dialogue: You forgot to check under the bed.

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: No monsters here.

Speaker: lizzy
Dialogue: But what if they come back?

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Then we'll just have to kick their ass again.

Speaker: lizzy
Dialogue: I love you, Meagan.

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: I love you too. Go to sleep.

Speaker: meagan's dad
Dialogue: Meagan?

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Yes, dad?

Speaker: meagan's dad
Dialogue: Your mom and I... well, we want to thank you for saving your sister's life... we know you went through a lot.

Speaker: meagan's mom
Dialogue: We're going to be there for you from now on... for both of you! And that nice lawyer we hired for you said he thinks he can get all the charges dropped... except maybe for the grave robbing and human desecration ones.

Speaker: meagan's dad
Dialogue: Everything is going to be fine.

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: I know...

Speaker: meagan's mom
Dialogue: And I'm going to get sober...

Speaker: meagan's dad
Dialogue: We're going to be a normal, happy family again.

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: I know...

Speaker: meagan's mom
Dialogue: Goodnight, sweetheart.

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Goodnight mom... goodnight dad.

Speaker: meagan's dad
Dialogue: Goodnight, Meagan.

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: Hello?

Speaker: freddy
Dialogue: I'll be seeing you in your dreams...

Speaker: meagan
Dialogue: I know...

Speaker: monster
Dialogue: I don't think they're coming back.

Speaker: ted bundy
Dialogue: Okay, folks... show's over. Every- body can go home now.
